\subsection{Detailed Description}
Module for File System operations. 

\subsection{Function Documentation}
\hypertarget{namespacechaos_1_1io_1_1sys_ae8f4abc1388c24e0ce7a655a50cd0212}{}\index{chaos\+::io\+::sys@{chaos\+::io\+::sys}!exists@{exists}}

\begin{DoxyParamCaption}
\item[{const {\bf chaos\+::io\+::sys\+::\+Path} \&}]{path, }
\item[{bool}]{resolve\+\_\+links = {\ttfamily false}}
\end{DoxyParamCaption}
)}\label{namespacechaos_1_1io_1_1sys_ae8f4abc1388c24e0ce7a655a50cd0212}


Checks whether the given path exists on the file system. 

This operation does not concern with the type of the path, this will return true if the path is a directory, file, symbolic link, or hard link.


\begin{DoxyParams}{Parameters}
{\em path} & The path to check for existence. \\
\hline
{\em resolve\+\_\+links} & Controls whether the operation will follow symbolic links and treat them as the path it points to or if the path to a symbolic link should be treated as the absolute path to the link itself (default behavior). This argument has no effect on Windows platforms since symbolic linking is not supported by Windows. \\
\hline
\end{DoxyParams}
\begin{DoxyReturn}{Returns}
Returns True if the path exists, false otherwise. 
\end{DoxyReturn}
\hypertarget{namespacechaos_1_1io_1_1sys_a2afa9dc6f049b03265731be671dbcb17}{}\index{chaos\+::io\+::sys@{chaos\+::io\+::sys}!is\+\_\+file@{is\+\_\+file}}

\item[{const {\bf chaos\+::io\+::sys\+::\+Path} \&}]{path}
\end{DoxyParamCaption}
)}\label{namespacechaos_1_1io_1_1sys_a21398064d60d0d4ac225a2c5004adf06}


Lists the file system paths located under the given path. 

This operation performs a similar function to the {\ttfamily ls} command on Linux, or the {\ttfamily dir} command on Windows. An empty vector will be returned if the given path does not exist or is .not a directory. This function will not resolve a symbolic link if one is provided as the input path. \hypertarget{namespacechaos_1_1io_1_1sys_a956856df76f476b3300ab1ebe733e2a7}{}\index{chaos\+::io\+::sys@{chaos\+::io\+::sys}!list\+\_\+rec@{list\+\_\+rec}}
\index{list\+\_\+rec@{list\+\_\+rec}!chaos\+::io\+::sys@{chaos\+::io\+::sys}}
\subsubsection[{list\+\_\+rec(const chaos\+::io\+::sys\+::\+Path \&path)}]{\setlength{\rightskip}{0pt plus 5cm}std\+::vector$<$ {\bf chaos\+::io\+::sys\+::\+Path} $>$ chaos\+::io\+::sys\+::list\+\_\+rec (
\begin{DoxyParamCaption}
\item[{const {\bf chaos\+::io\+::sys\+::\+Path} \&}]{path}
\end{DoxyParamCaption}
)}\label{namespacechaos_1_1io_1_1sys_a956856df76f476b3300ab1ebe733e2a7}


Lists all descendant file system paths located under the given path. 

This operation returns a vector similar to that of \hyperlink{namespacechaos_1_1io_1_1sys_a21398064d60d0d4ac225a2c5004adf06}{list()}, except any sub paths that are also directories are traversed and so on, so that this function returns all paths that are a descendant of the given path. This function will not resolve symbolics in order to avoid infinite recursion. \hypertarget{namespacechaos_1_1io_1_1sys_a6bcdadf916b110395f4a2627c049da11}{}\index{chaos\+::io\+::sys@{chaos\+::io\+::sys}!create\+\_\+directory@{create\+\_\+directory}}
\index{create\+\_\+directory@{create\+\_\+directory}!chaos\+::io\+::sys@{chaos\+::io\+::sys}}
\subsubsection[{create\+\_\+directory(const chaos\+::io\+::sys\+::\+Path \&path)}]{\setlength{\rightskip}{0pt plus 5cm}bool chaos\+::io\+::sys\+::create\+\_\+directory (
\begin{DoxyParamCaption}
\item[{const {\bf chaos\+::io\+::sys\+::\+Path} \&}]{path}
\end{DoxyParamCaption}
)}\label{namespacechaos_1_1io_1_1sys_a6bcdadf916b110395f4a2627c049da11}


Attempts to create the directory at the given path.

\hypertarget{namespacechaos_1_1io_1_1sys_afe2226ee576ac8aba15ca3baa0322ff6}{}\index{chaos\+::io\+::sys@{chaos\+::io\+::sys}!delete\+\_\+path@{delete\+\_\+path}}

\subsubsection[{delete\+\_\+path(const chaos\+::io\+::sys\+::\+Path \&path)}]{\setlength{\rightskip}{0pt plus 5cm}void chaos\+::io\+::sys\+::delete\+\_\+path (
\begin{DoxyParamCaption}
\item[{const {\bf chaos\+::io\+::sys\+::\+Path} \&}]{path}
\end{DoxyParamCaption}
)}\label{namespacechaos_1_1io_1_1sys_afe2226ee576ac8aba15ca3baa0322ff6}


Deletes the given \hyperlink{classchaos_1_1io_1_1sys_1_1_path}{Path} on the file system if it exists. 

This operation will fail if the given path is a non-\/empty directory, see \hyperlink{namespacechaos_1_1io_1_1sys_a00c090bbfe1da7e7cb00dc99c7459a21}{chaos\+::io\+::sys\+::delete\+\_\+path\+\_\+rec()} to delete non-\/empty directories.

\begin{DoxyNote}{Note}
This operation will delete symbolic link objects but will not follow them to delete the path they point to.
\end{DoxyNote}

\begin{DoxyExceptions}{Exceptions}
{\em \hyperlink{classchaos_1_1io_1_1sys_1_1_invalid_path_error}{chaos\+::io\+::sys\+::\+Invalid\+Path\+Error}} & If the path cannot be accessed and/or modified to be deleted. \\
\hline
\end{DoxyExceptions}
\hypertarget{namespacechaos_1_1io_1_1sys_a00c090bbfe1da7e7cb00dc99c7459a21}{}\index{chaos\+::io\+::sys@{chaos\+::io\+::sys}!delete\+\_\+path\+\_\+rec@{delete\+\_\+path\+\_\+rec}}
\index{delete\+\_\+path\+\_\+rec@{delete\+\_\+path\+\_\+rec}!chaos\+::io\+::sys@{chaos\+::io\+::sys}}
\subsubsection[{delete\+\_\+path\+\_\+rec(const chaos\+::io\+::sys\+::\+Path \&path)}]{\setlength{\rightskip}{0pt plus 5cm}void chaos\+::io\+::sys\+::delete\+\_\+path\+\_\+rec (
\begin{DoxyParamCaption}
\item[{const {\bf chaos\+::io\+::sys\+::\+Path} \&}]{path}
\end{DoxyParamCaption}
)}\label{namespacechaos_1_1io_1_1sys_a00c090bbfe1da7e7cb00dc99c7459a21}


Deletes the given path on the file system and all subsequent paths under the given path. 

This effectively performs the same job as \hyperlink{namespacechaos_1_1io_1_1sys_afe2226ee576ac8aba15ca3baa0322ff6}{chaos\+::io\+::sys\+::delete\+\_\+path()} except that non-\/empty directories will also be deleted by this operation.

\begin{DoxyNote}{Note}
This operation will delete symbolic link objects but will not follow them to delete the path they point to.
\end{DoxyNote}

\begin{DoxyExceptions}{Exceptions}
{\em \hyperlink{classchaos_1_1io_1_1sys_1_1_invalid_path_error}{chaos\+::io\+::sys\+::\+Invalid\+Path\+Error}} & If a path in the directory hierarchy cannot be accessed and/or modified to be deleted. \\
\hline
\end{DoxyExceptions}
\hypertarget{namespacechaos_1_1io_1_1sys_a15e20b105c40cf4d73b13afe87ce1781}{}\index{chaos\+::io\+::sys@{chaos\+::io\+::sys}!validate@{validate}}
\index{validate@{validate}!chaos\+::io\+::sys@{chaos\+::io\+::sys}}
\subsubsection[{validate(const chaos\+::io\+::sys\+::\+Path \&path)}]{\setlength{\rightskip}{0pt plus 5cm}void chaos\+::io\+::sys\+::validate (
\begin{DoxyParamCaption}
\item[{const {\bf chaos\+::io\+::sys\+::\+Path} \&}]{path}
\end{DoxyParamCaption}
)}\label{namespacechaos_1_1io_1_1sys_a15e20b105c40cf4d73b13afe87ce1781}


Attempts to ensure all directories up to the provided path exist. 

If any directories up to the final component of the provided path do not exist this operation will attempt to create them. If the given path cannot be validated this will fail with an exception.

This operation is useful to ensure a path is available for writing.

Example usage\+:


\begin{DoxyCode}
\hyperlink{classchaos_1_1io_1_1sys_1_1_path}{chaos::io::sys::Path} p;
p << \textcolor{stringliteral}{"example"} << \textcolor{stringliteral}{"path"} << \textcolor{stringliteral}{"to"} << \textcolor{stringliteral}{"filename.txt"};
\hyperlink{namespacechaos_1_1io_1_1sys_a15e20b105c40cf4d73b13afe87ce1781}{chaos::io::sys::validate}( p );
\textcolor{comment}{// this will attempt to ensure example/path/to/ exists, if this operations}
\textcolor{comment}{// failed an exception would have been thrown.}
\textcolor{comment}{// We can now begin writing to filename.txt knowing that it's containing}
\textcolor{comment}{// directory exists.}
std::ofstream open\_file( p.\hyperlink{classchaos_1_1io_1_1sys_1_1_path_adb68b7589d18dc78f19d9dd6936d9833}{to\_native}().\hyperlink{classchaos_1_1uni_1_1_u_t_f8_string_a91d3bb4cfbfb573b3fa6ecf3312f4dee}{get\_raw}() );
\end{DoxyCode}

\hline

\hline
\end{DoxyExceptions}
